articles.headline: Investors, Dismayed by Losses at Sears, Pull Money From Hedge Fund
articles.snippet: Edward S. Lampert was once hailed in the same league as Warren Buffett, but his struggles with Sears have disenchanted a number of investors.
articles.abstract: Edward S. Lampert was once hailed in the same league as Warren Buffett, but his struggles with Sears have disenchanted a number of investors.
articles.lead_paragraph: The storied investing empire of Edward S. Lampert is shrinking.

articles.headline: Nelson Mandela, South Africa’s Liberator as Prisoner and President, Dies at 95
articles.snippet: Mr. Mandela’s quest for freedom in South Africa’s system of white rule took him from the court of tribal royalty to the liberation underground to a prison cell to the presidency.
articles.abstract: Mr. Mandela’s quest for freedom in South Africa’s system of white rule took him from the court of tribal royalty to the liberation underground to a prison cell to the presidency.
articles.lead_paragraph: Nelson Mandela, who led the emancipation of South Africa from white minority rule and served as his country’s first black president, becoming an international emblem of dignity and forbearance, died Thursday night. He was 95.

articles.headline: In the Murky World of Bitcoin, Fraud Is Quicker Than the Law
articles.snippet: Illicit activity is rising in the virtual currency market, where there is an increasing amount of real money but few rules and even less oversight.
articles.abstract: Illicit activity is rising in the virtual currency market, where there is an increasing amount of real money but few rules and even less oversight.
articles.lead_paragraph: The call went out on Twitter: “For insane profits come and join the pump.”

articles.headline: Treating Allergies With Pills or Drops Instead of Shots
articles.snippet: Two companies are asking the Food and Drug Administration for approval to market tablets or liquids to treat allergies, drugs which are already available in Europe.
articles.abstract: Two companies are asking the Food and Drug Administration for approval to market tablets or liquids to treat allergies, drugs which are already available in Europe.
articles.lead_paragraph: For much of her adult life, Shirley Hickey received two injections a week in an effort to tame severe allergies that caused frequent sore throats and sinus infections. Now she uses a less painful method.

articles.headline: Congress Nears Modest Accord on the Budget
articles.snippet: Conservative House Republicans are likely to balk at the deal, and Democrats have not said whether they will make their support contingent on an extension of jobless benefits.
articles.abstract: Conservative House Republicans are likely to balk at the deal, and Democrats have not said whether they will make their support contingent on an extension of jobless benefits.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — House and Senate negotiators on Thursday closed in on a budget deal that, while modest in scope, could break the cycle of fiscal crises and brinkmanship that has hampered the economic recovery and driven public opinion of Congress to an all-time low.

articles.headline: California City’s Return to Solvency, With Pension Problem Unsolved
articles.snippet: Stockton has gone through what Detroit faces and hopes to emerge from bankruptcy protection in the spring. But its biggest problem, pension payments, still looms.
articles.abstract: Stockton has gone through what Detroit faces and hopes to emerge from bankruptcy protection in the spring. But its biggest problem, pension payments, still looms.
articles.lead_paragraph: STOCKTON, Calif. — Before Detroit filed for bankruptcy, there was Stockton.
articles.byline: By Rick Lyman and Mary Williams Walsh

articles.headline: On the World’s Roads, More American Wheels
articles.snippet: A big part of the American auto industry’s comeback has come from rising exports of vehicles made in the United States for sale in international markets.
articles.abstract: A big part of the American auto industry’s comeback has come from rising exports of vehicles made in the United States for sale in international markets.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — The resurgence of the American auto industry has been driven primarily by pent-up demand for new cars and trucks by consumers in the United States.

articles.headline: Lowest Jobless Rate in 5 Years Raises Odds of a Fed Move
articles.snippet: November’s strong jobs report closes a week of strong economic news and gave President Obama’s administration a rare bit of good news.
articles.abstract: November’s strong jobs report closes a week of strong economic news and gave President Obama’s administration a rare bit of good news.
articles.lead_paragraph: After years of frustrating fits and starts in the wake of the financial crisis and the Great Recession, the United States economy finally appears to be generating jobs at a healthier, more sustainable pace that many analysts now think will continue into 2014. The official unemployment rate fell in November to its lowest level since 2008.

articles.headline: Wanted: More Unemployment
articles.snippet: The jobless rate is an odd measuring stick for the health of the labor market, since it falls not only when people find work, but also when they stop looking.
articles.abstract: The jobless rate is an odd measuring stick for the health of the labor market, since it falls not only when people find work, but also when they stop looking.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is bad news for the American economy that the unemployment rate fell in November. Yes, you read that correctly: We need higher unemployment.

articles.headline: More Hours, More Earnings
articles.snippet: The average workweek and hourly earnings among the labor force for private employers both grew last month, gains that could translate into increased consumer spending.
articles.abstract: The average workweek and hourly earnings among the labor force for private employers both grew last month, gains that could translate into increased consumer spending.
articles.lead_paragraph: Here’s some good news in this good-news jobs report: Earnings climbed last month. That means that while many more Americans are finding jobs, the ones that are already working got a boost, too.

articles.headline: Short-Term Gains, Long-Term Trouble
articles.snippet: The number of people out of work for less than five weeks is now below pre-recession levels, but the ranks of long-term unemployed continue to exceed previous cycles.
articles.abstract: The number of people out of work for less than five weeks is now below pre-recession levels, but the ranks of long-term unemployed continue to exceed previous cycles.
articles.lead_paragraph: Most of the job numbers, even when they look good, are still not even close to what they were before the Great Recession, which officially began in December 2007.
